title: Cryptocurrency Towns Part 1: Getting Started - Complete Town-Building Guide
author: marsresident / Van Kush Family
overview: Comprehensive guide to founding cryptocurrency-powered towns with solar mining, sustainable housing (Earthships/Cob/Adobe), community infrastructure, democratic organization, and economic independence

core_vision.thesis: 25,000 people in a town with solar-powered mining could outmine every existing Bitcoin/Litecoin/Ethereum farm
core_vision.mechanism: Solar panels + Alternators/Generators = Free income generation for residents
core_vision.goal: Create self-sustaining communities with cryptocurrency infrastructure

quiz_questions.q: What is the approximate minimum land needed to start a town?
quiz_questions.a: 6 acres, with county approval or vote from splitting town, plus a Town Charter
quiz_questions.explanation: Town Charter functions as constitution for the new municipality

quiz_questions.q: What are Earthships and what makes them sustainable?
quiz_questions.a: Houses built with old tires filled with cement, oriented east-west facing sunrise, using solar panels and rain collection
quiz_questions.explanation: Cob (clay+straw) is earthquake and fire resistant and can extend Earthships

quiz_questions.q: What was the Agora in Greek democracy?
quiz_questions.a: The center of the Polis where people gathered to vote - started as area marked by stones, evolved into structures
quiz_questions.explanation: 12 Tribes, 1 People - Federation of ideas model

quiz_questions.q: Which local elections actually matter most?
quiz_questions.a: Sheriff, Judge, District Attorney, Mayor - many DA positions run unopposed
quiz_questions.explanation: Presidential elections matter less than local control

quiz_questions.q: What is the most important piece of equipment for starting a town?
quiz_questions.a: Well Digger - everything expands from there, can also find minerals or oil
quiz_questions.explanation: Must have mineral rights to the land
